title: FS or FT T213-2 HOFers and Toughies Prices Reduced
author: t213

posts.post_title: FS or FT T213-2 HOFers and Toughies Prices Reduced
posts.post_content:
As many board members know, I'm trying to put my T213-2 set to rest. I need 8 more (see below) and would love to trade these dupes for the ones I need. If not, I'm happy to sell them too. 
thanks, Andy

My T213-2 Wantlist:
Demmitt (NY on Shirt)
Magee (Phila caption)
McQuillan (Phila caption)
Murray (Chicago)
Reulbach (Brooklyn Fed)
Sweeney (Richmond)
Tinker (Chicago Nat, Bat on Shoulder)
Wheat (Brooklyn)

Available:
A note on condition - the HOFers are all PSA-1 - for the life of me, these are about the nicest PSA-1s I own - see the scans. The backs are all clean and  have no paperloss, smudges or writing.

Baker New York Amer - not as difficult as his Phila Amer card, but much tougher than his Philadelphia Amer version was $160 now $135

Bender Philadelphia Nat - this is a difficult card because it was only issued in 1916. Check out Ebay and you'll see how many Philadelphia Amer versions there are, but not Philadelphia Nat SOLD

Collins Chicago Amer A on shirt - the most difficult of the three Collins variations SOLD

Crawford was $150 now $125
Griffith was $150 now $125
Jennings both hands - was $150 now $125
Marquard portrait NY Nat - was $150 now $125
Tinker Chicago Fed Bat Off Shoulder was $150 now $125

Quinn Vernon PCL - this is a tough card, issued only in 1916, one of three PCL cards in the set (the other two are both Frank Chance) SOLD
Are there  just  2 different baltimore Benders in t213-2? I have a trees and no trees.

There are six Benders in the set - with and without trees for each of three teams Philadelphia Amer (1914), Baltimore Fed (1915) and Philadelphia Nat (1916). The Amer card is by far the easiest, Nat is tougher and Baltimore is the toughest of all.

Andy

Dang!!!!  Who bought the Collins that I have been after, and how much did it go for?!
Come on over habd hit me with a price,
Bob
[url]upperhandisforemost@yahoo.com[/url]
Hey Bob, lucky for you I grabbed the Collins,holla !

Johnny,
Word to ones kin folks!
